knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

```{r reading-laborforce-data, eval=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)

list.files(
  path = "data/labor force cty/",
  pattern = '\\.xlsx', 
  full.names = TRUE
  ) -> filenames 

purrr::map_df(
  filenames, 
  readxl::read_excel, 
  .id = 'laucnty'
  ) -> df

df[, 1:11] -> df2
df2$...6 = NULL 

df[6:106450, 1:11] %>%
  rename(
    file = laucnty, 
    laus.code = `Labor Force Data by County, 2000 Annual Averages`,
    state.fips = ...2, 
    county.fips = ...3,
    name = ...4,
    year = ...5,
    labor.force = ...7,
    employed = ...8,
    unemployed = ...9,
    unemployment.rate = ...10
    ) -> lf

lf$...6 = NULL
lf %>%
  filter(year != 'Year') -> labor_force

save(labor_force, file = "data/labor force cty/labor_force.rdata")
```

```{r}
load("data/labor force cty/labor_force.rdata")

labor_force %>% filter(state.fips == 39) -> ohio
```
